The VideoProcAmpProperty enumeration specifies video properties on a video capture device.

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_Brightness
member.summary: Specifies the brightness, also called the black level. For NTSC, the value is expressed in IRE units * 100. For non-NTSC sources, the units are arbitrary, with zero representing blanking and 10,000 representing pure white. Values range from –10,000 to 10,000.

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_Contrast
member.summary: Specifies the contrast, expressed as gain factor * 100. Values range from zero to 10,000.

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_Hue
member.summary: Specifies the hue, in degrees * 100. Values range from -180,000 to 180,000 (-180 to +180 degrees).

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_Saturation
member.summary: Specifies the saturation. Values range from 0 to 10,000.

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_Sharpness
member.summary: Specifies the sharpness. Values range from 0 to 100.

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_Gamma
member.summary: Specifies the gamma, as gamma * 100. Values range from 1 to 500.

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_ColorEnable
member.summary: Specifies the color enable setting. The possible values are 0 (off) and 1 (on).

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_WhiteBalance
member.summary: Specifies the white balance, as a color temperature in degrees Kelvin. The range of values depends on the device.

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_BacklightCompensation
member.summary: Specifies the backlight compensation setting. Possible values are 0 (off) and 1 (on).

member.name: VideoProcAmpProperty.VideoProcAmp_Gain
member.summary: Specifies the gain adjustment. Zero is normal. Positive values are brighter and negative values are darker. The range of values depends on the device.
